intro: Gomphocarpus schimperi, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds with silky hairs, aiding in wind dispersal. Its milky sap contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Gomphocarpus schimperi is often found in open woodlands and savannas, thriving in well-drained soils.
